duties_responsibilities.duty: Conduct pipe stress engineering of piping systems as per ASME Codes using Caesar II software program.
Coordinate the design of exclusive pipe supports as needed.
Perform static analysis using CAESAR II for various load cases and vibration analysis.
Develop plans for sharing resources among competing projects, including management of subcontractors.
Review vendor drawing submittals and conduct technical bid evaluation.
Participate in reviews of PFDs, P&IDs, Piping ISOs, & Structural Drawings.
Ensure engineering quality and timeliness in a cross-functional engineering environment.
Develop piping schematics and layouts based on customer requirements and specifications.
Provide technical follow-up and support on piping matters, from proposal stage to operation.
Demonstrate knowledge in Piping and layout engineering, procurement, and cost-effectiveness.
Possess a basic knowledge of offshore production process requirements and the capability of developing P&IDs from customer specifications.
Familiarity with risk assessment concepts and methods.
Possess advanced computer skills and time management skills.
Be a self-starter able to work with minimal supervision, analyze problems, and provide focused solutions.
Have strong interpersonal and communication skills and be able to work well with people at all levels in the organization.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical Engineering. 15-20 years of experience in Oil & Gas FPSO, Offshore platforms, Petrochemical, or Refinery Industries. A minimum of eight years of experience as Piping Stress Engineer/Lead Stress Engineer for FPSO/offshore Platform based Projects.
